metadata.case_name: Commissioner of Income-tax v. Chamanlal Mangaldas Co. (C.A. No. 162 of 1958) and Mangaldas Girdhar Das Parekh Ltd. (C.A. No. 210 of 1958)

facts.text: Two appeals by Commissioner of Income-tax against judgments of High Court of Bombay on references from Income-tax Appellate Tribunal.
In C.A. No. 162 of 1958, respondent Chamanlal Mangaldas Co., registered firm, managing agents of Girdhardas Harivallabhadas Mills Ltd., Ahmedabad.

Managing agency agreement dated September 7, 1940: commission at 3 1/2% on sale price of cotton yarn and cloth, 3 1/2% on sale proceeds of yarn and fabrics from wool, jute, silk etc., 10% on profits from ginning/pressing.
Directors' resolution dated December 28, 1950, modifying commission terms for 1950-1951: directors may fix lesser remuneration in absolute discretion.
Managing agents accepted modification by letter dated December 28, 1950.
Supplemental agreement dated March 17, 1951, adding proviso embodying December 28, 1950 resolution.
Board resolution dated April 8, 1951: fixed commission at Rs. 1,05,575 instead of Rs. 2,05,575 (Rs. 1,00,000 less).

Book entry on December 31, 1950: credited Rs. 1,05,575-3-0 to managing agents' account, noting calculation at 3 1/2% on sales Rs. 58,73,557 was Rs. 2,05,575 but per April 8, 1951 resolution, only Rs. 1,05,575 credited.
Income-tax authorities held entire Rs. 2,05,575 taxable as accrued income; Rs. 1,00,000 voluntary surrender.
ITAT order dated February 9, 1954: right to full Rs. 2,05,575 taken away from January 1, 1950; not voluntary relinquishment; taxable Rs. 1,05,575.
High Court on reference: income Rs. 1,05,575, no accrual of full amount.
In C.A. No. 210 of 1958, respondent Mangaldas Girdhar Das Parekh Ltd., private company, managing agent of Rajnagar Spinning Weaving and Manufacturing Co. Ltd., Ahmedabad.
Agreement dated May 9, 1947: 3% commission on gross sale proceeds of yarn and cloth; proviso if insufficient profit for Rs. 1,20,000 dividend, managing agent gives up up to 1/3 commission.
Resolution dated December 28, 1950: varying commission for 1950-1951, directors may fix lesser remuneration.
Supplemental agreement dated March 17, 1951, embodying resolution.
Resolution dated April 8, 1951: fixed remuneration Rs. 4,11,875 instead of Rs. 5,11,875 (Rs. 1,00,000 less).
Book entry noting amount accrued Rs. 5,11,875 but entitled to Rs. 4,11,875; commissions credited every six months as interim.
Tribunal and High Court decided in favor of managing agent; taxable Rs. 4,11,875.

legal_issues.text: Whether there was a voluntary relinquishment by managing agents of Rs. 1,00,000 part of commission, making full commission under original agreements taxable, or whether the reduced amount under modified agreements is the accrued taxable income.

petitioner_arguments.text: Entire commission under original agreement (Rs. 2,05,575 / Rs. 5,11,875) accrued as income during previous year; reduction of Rs. 1,00,000 is mere voluntary surrender not affecting taxability.
Reliance on book entries showing full amount 'accrued'.

respondent_arguments.text: As result of agreements/modifications, right to full remuneration taken away from January 1, 1950; not voluntary relinquishment; taxable only reduced amount.

court_reasoning.text: Commission clause is integrated whole; payable/determinable at end of year based on all sales and profits; modification effective; book entry on Dec 31, 1950 credits reduced amount; accrual is reduced sum Rs. 1,05,575.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Right to receive commission accrues at end of accounting year when sales added up and accounts made up.

court_reasoning.text: In second appeal, clause 3 integrated; commission at 3% on sales determinable at year-end; proviso on contribution to dividends after profits determined; half-year credits interim only; accrual is reduced Rs. 4,11,875.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Amount entitled to receive under modified arrangement is what accrues; book entry read as whole shows entitlement to reduced sum.

holdings.text: Amount liable to income-tax is reduced commission managing agents entitled to receive under modified agreements (Rs. 1,05,575 and Rs. 4,11,875); no accrual of full original amount.

precedents_cited.relevance: Similar question determined on same basis; decided today.

statutes_cited.name: Income-tax Act
statutes_cited.relevance: Determination of accrual of income for taxation.

outcome.summary: Supreme Court upholds High Court and Tribunal; rules that taxable commission is reduced amount fixed under modified agreements; Rs. 1,00,000 difference not accrued income but result of variation effective from start of year.
outcome.relief_granted: Assessees (managing agents) liable to tax only on reduced commissions.

key_quotes.text: the amount which accrued or which they were entitled to receive was the latter sum i.e., Rs. 1,05,575 and not what would have been payable had there been no variation in and modification of the agreement.
key_quotes.speaker: court

key_quotes.text: the amount liable to income-tax would be the amount which the respective managing agents were entitled to receive as commission for, that would be the amount which would accrue or arise in each case
key_quotes.speaker: court
